alert.note: Alert for Barton; Ellsworth; Reno; Rice (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued February 21 at 6:01PM CST until February 21 at 7:30PM CST by NWS Wichita
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wichita has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Western Reno County in south central Kansas... Rice County in central Kansas... Southern Ellsworth County in central Kansas... Barton County in central Kansas... * Until 730 PM CST. * At 557 PM CST, a dust channel was over Hanston, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Less than two miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph with a few wind gusts up to 60 mph SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * Highways 281, 56, K-4, K-96 and K-156 are all expected to be affected over the next hour and a half. Considering getting off the highway until the dust storm passes. High profile vehicles will be especially affected. Locations impacted include... Great Bend, Lyons, Hoisington, Sterling, Ellinwood, Nickerson, Claflin, Kanopolis, Little River, Chase, Arlington, Holyrood, Turon, Bushton, Geneseo, Pawnee Rock, Partridge, Sylvia, Albert and Alden. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
